name: Lance Aux Epines Cottages

reviews.text: We just spent 5 days with LAEC. It was great. The convenience to the beach and having the sailboat and kayaks available were perfect. The apartment was huge! We used Ann, the housekeeper to cook for us one day. It was the best meal we had on the island. She gave us a shopping list, cooked it before she left that afternoon and we heated it up when we were ready. We asked for traditional food and she provided.
reviews.title: Clean, Safe, Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thania at the front office was great in answering questions before we got there, including arranging our airport transfers. They give you lots of information to guide you in daily activities. Wifi was spotty. Security was on the premise. Based off of the locations of the other hotels from the beach, we think this was the best choice. It was a short drive by taxi into town but in walking distance there were restaurants and a mini mart. We walked over to prickly bay marina one night for 'pub food' and bingo, we walked down the street to the Red Crab another night. We highly recommend this paradise... it was our own little world.
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.text: We enjoyed staying at the Hummingbird Cottage. When Liat went on strike, Tim the manager helped us make other arrangements.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Friendly, Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are nice, swimming ok, and the view pleasant.
reviews.title: A great place to chill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spend 5 days at Lance Aux Epines Cottages and loved it. The beach was peaceful, clean and uncrowded. The staff was delightful and Grenada was Grenada.
reviews.title: PERFECT FOR US!

reviews.text: Chose this hotel because of its price and internet reviews, and so felt compelled to add my two cents. First, the positives: absolutely great set-up if you have a small child...during the day, I just opened the door to our cottage (you could do the same with apartments) and my 3 year old just played outside in the yard/garden area in my full view, which was a safe area, not close to any roads or parking lots. This made my trip extremely laid back and enjoyable, and gave my kid freedom to just be a kid. Not sure if we could have gotten that freedom in a resort with lots of rooms and pools, etc. because of the inherent safety issues....I saw no safety issues on these grounds so could just let her play while I swung in hammock, or read in the cottage. All of the units are super close to the beach....I didn't see a single place in Grenada, other than private homes, where you could stay that close to the beach. I'm guessing 30 yards from the beach from the front door of our cottage. The cottages were large...probably 600 sf...the great room with full kitchen and sitting area is not air conditioned, but had two large fans and only screens on the windows so the temperature was perfect and A/C was needed. The bedroom had A/C but also a fan and we froze when we used the A/C the first night, so didn't use it again. For those that like their hotel room freezing, you can definitely make it happen in the bedroom. office staff and night time security guard were great. I've traveled all over the Caribbean and even lived in Bahamas and Cayman for a year and you don't get friendly faces like this anywhere else in the Caribbean...the nature of the Grenada people is shocking for us because of what we are used to from the other islanders.
reviews.title: Great Set-up for Families with Small Children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bay this hotel sits on is secluded and wonderful...no peddlers and lots of privacy with really only the other guests sharing the beach with you.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the negatives, and there weren't really any negatives, just a suggestion on how I thought they could improve...I thought the decor of the units could be improved a bit. Excellent value for the island at current rates, super clean and beds and furniture comfortable, but with some modest "trendy" decor upgrades, I think they could give the rooms a more boutique/unique feel using some cheap options without having to raise their prices.
reviews.title: Great location, peace & tranquility - plenty to see around the island

reviews.text: Loved the Sunset Bar on Sundays....loved, loved, loved our housekeeper "Eva", and the
reviews.title: Wonderful for families, good beach for swimming, walk to restaurants.

reviews.text: I would definitely come back here. PS- the food hamper was a great idea, and a great value....for $40, our cottage was stocked with imported butter, awesome local bread, a huge local fruit platter, eggs, milk, tea, cream, a box of corn flakes and jam. We were only going to be there 3 days, so that food hamper allowed us to eat breakfast and lunch two or three times while we preferred to eat dinner out at restaurants. It was definitely worth $40 even if you plan to stock up at a local grocery store when you get there.
reviews.title: Favorite Family Spot in Grenada

reviews.text: LAE was just the escape I was looking for. Having arrived very early (pre-dawn on the only direct flight from JFK), I was immediately picked up by the airport transfer company that the ever-so-kind Thaneia at LAE pre-arranged for me, and in 10 minutes I was at the cottages. While the office wasn't open, their security guard was expecting me, greeted me and escorted me to the "Roost". Tim, the general manager, arrived at around 8 AM and assured me that my room would be prepared as quickly as possible. Upon request, he graciously provided me with a couple of beach towels, so I changed and headed right to the beach. At about 11 AM, my housekeeper for the week, Josepha (a truly kind and warm person) found me on the beach, and brought me upstairs to the Kite apartment. While somewhat spartan, the accommodation has all the basics you need (although a reading light in the living room and black-out shades in the bedroom would be welcome additions). LAE even brought in a few groceries for me, which were waiting in the fridge.
reviews.title: A Truly Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: The beach is small but very nice. It’s not a long or wide beach, but it is so uncrowded, you'll feel like you've found your own island. Looking out from the beach to the horizon, the bay is spotted with sailboats, catamarans, etc. creating a pretty view at night. Both the beach and LAE property is meticulously maintained. Beautiful flowering plants are everywhere, the lawn is lush and there are a variety of palms, Manchineel and other trees thoughtfully placed to ensure that you have shade when you want to take a break from the sun. Absolutely lovely.
reviews.title: Fantastic Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tim is kind enough to host a Sunday Beach BBQ (loved the lambie waters soup!) as well as a Manager's Meet & Greet on Thursday afternoon at their Sand Bar. While I confess I'm not a "joiner", I could see that many of the other visitors enjoyed it. Don't miss the rum punch - delicious.
reviews.title: I can't say enough about this charming place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What most impressed me was the staff. When I complemented Tim on the wonderful environment and campus he has created, he didn’t take any credit for himself; he simply replied, “I have a really good team.” I can’t really say enough about the staff – everyone was so welcoming, professional and kind, I immediately felt "at home". You can see the pride they take in making sure each of their guests is comfortable, happy and as busy or as quiet as they want to be. They have even prepared a guide, located in each apartment / cottage, with helpful hints, where to go and how to get there, restaurants within walking distance, etc. A very smart and thoughtful touch.
reviews.title: True Carribean experience! Amazing!

reviews.text: My sincerest thanks to all at LAE! Happy 2011 to all!
reviews.title: A beautiful getaway in the middle of Paradise!

reviews.text: If you want to get away, but still have access to the outside world, this is the place to be. Great recreation, on a picturesque calm bay perfect for swimming and sailing, unparralleled sunsets, and the best hosts. Grenada is a humid and lush gorgeous island. Grenadians are the kindest, friendliest people I have had the privilege of knowing. Lance Aux Epines Cottages are just outside of St. George's, with easy access to the airport and shopping. Easy, casual relaxation in paradise!
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without a doubt, the cottages are perfect for a holiday away from home. Ours was Hummingbird Cottage, which looks out onto the gardens and beach. The beach itself is about 6 footsteps from your cottage and the bay is private with calm waters. The cottage was spacious and in great condition, everything cheery and spotless. The kitchen surprised us, perfectly fitted out for cooking your own meals, and the hamper was a great idea, containing essentials such as butter, milk, cheese, jam, fruit, tea, coffee etc. We found the cottage and grounds so relaxing that the temptation was there to spend the morning puttering about instead of hitting the road to explore. Lance Aux Epines is just minutes away from the St Georges Campus, minutes away from great fishing and snorkelling, and close to a number of supermarkets and restaurants. Grand Anse was a mere 7 minute drive away, but I preferred the beach and water at Lance Aux Epines. We cannot recommend the Cottages enough! In all of my travels abroad, this one stands out as the perfect accommodation.
reviews.title: September 2011- Fantastic accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cottage proved to be a little gem. Perfectly located on the beach in immaculately managed grounds with your own loungers, hammock and picnic table. The cottage was spotlessly clean, well equipped and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The food hamper provided on our arrival was brilliant and all the fruit delicious. We had hired a car, which made access to all local beaches, shops and restaurants very easy and there was dedicated parking available at the cottage. Definitely a place to recommend and to which we would return.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: We are a family of four, including a 4 year old and an 18th month old.We really wanted a no fuss, straight-on-to-the-beach self-catering holiday and we completely landed on our feet. This place has a great deal of charm, comfort, understated sophistication and is impeccably run by very friendly, genuine and professional staff. We are already planning our return trip next year. A hidden gem.
reviews.title: The Best Family Beach Holiday One Could Wish For..

reviews.text: The cottages are perfectly located. You felt away from everything yet not far from anything. The environment was serene and the grounds are meticulously kept. The beach was great especially for little children to swim in. The staff was especially helpful and we were never made to feel like we were bothering them. The apartment was simple and very clean. The bonus for us was spending all day out and coming home to a hot home-cooked meal for a fraction of the cost we would spend in a restaurant to feed a family of 5.
reviews.title: It was perfect in every way-location, accomodation, staffing, and ambiance.

aka: Lance Aux Epines Cottages Hotel St. George`s
description: Fully equipped cottages and apartments on a peaceful tree-shaded beach. Maid/laundry service included so that you can relax!
